revised_title: Chemical Behavior of Argon and Helium: Experiments and Findings
tldr: This article presents experiments conducted on the chemical behavior of argon and helium. The authors found that these gases do not combine with other elements under severe chemical treatment. They also observed that helium does not have a tendency to combine with other elements, while argon shows a slight tendency to combine with some elements. The authors determined the vapor densities of various substances in both gases at high temperatures, providing insights into their chemical properties.
